options.content: Complete lesson plan, addressed all phases of the effective teaching cycle
Lesson plan unclear, incomplete, or unavailable

rows.tooltip:
1. Linked to sequenced IEP goal / objectives / instructional units
2. Appropriate relevant chunking
3. Sufficient number of trials and items
4. Scaffolding – includes reduction of support

options.content: Lesson Plan includes all 4 components
3 complete and accurate components
2 complete and accurate components or some components unrelated or insufficient
0-1 components complete and accurate or most components unrelated or insufficient

rows.tooltip:
1. Matching / adapting content to learners,
2. Accounting for diversity of learners,
3. Purpose / rationale for teaching content,
4. Age / developmentally appropriate

options.content: Lesson plan includes all elements of individualization
Some evidence of individualization
Little to no evidence of individualization
Materials gathered and ready for use
Materials not gathered or ready for use
Followed format or script in written program, adapted when needed
Followed portions of script, format or plan of written program or was not fluent
Did not follow format, script, or plan

rows.tooltip:
1. Includes relevant combination of individual, group and dispersed turns
2. Provides sufficient opportunities to respond to keep pupils engaged
3. Appropriate pacing

options.content: Includes all successful aspects of opportunities to respond
Response opportunities are too few or too many, engages some students
Teacher provides inadequate opportunities for pupils to respond and be engaged
Frequent eye contact and frequent scanning of group / classroom
Some eye contact and / or infrequent scanning of group / classroom
Little or no eye contact and / or no scanning of group / classroom

rows.tooltip:
1. clear academic expectations / directions
2. New Material - succinct and engaging demonstration / modeling
(includes clear steps, prompted known steps / decisions and modeled / taught new steps / decisions)
3. Guided / Individual Practice - appropriate scaffolding based on pupil responses
4. teacher language is brief and consistent
5. “thinks on feet” makes adjustments as needed

options.content: Includes all aspects of proper instruction
Approaching fluent use of all components of instruction
Inconsistent instruction, lack of model, and / or minimal scaffolding
Unclear instruction, scaffolding not based on pupil responses
Meaningful feedback linked to pupil’s responses and feedback motivates pupils to persevere
Some feedback or feedback not meaningful to pupils
Minimal meaningful feedback to pupils
Corrects all pupil errors, follows correction procedure ending in an independent correct pupil response
Corrects some pupil errors or inconsistent correction procedure
Minimal meaningful feedback to pupils
Appropriate enthusiasm, tone, and volume, relates positive attitude, age appropriate
Little / excessive enthusiasm, tone, and volume, or interferes with student learning and behavior
little or no enthusiasm, tone, and volume, interferes with student learning and behavior
Teacher uses all class time efficiently, maintains classroom schedule, smooth transition
Teacher uses most of class time efficiently, maintains classroom schedule, smooth transition
Teacher makes inefficient use of time and / or time lost on non-instructional activities
Positively States behavior expectations
Negatively states or does not include behavior expectations

rows.tooltip:
1. Teacher arranges pupils, materials and environment to positively engage pupils
2. Pupils are responding and attending most of the time
3. Teacher and / or pupils follow general classroom and school routines
(i.e., gathering materials, transitions, circle time, interruptions, start up and ending routines, etc.)

options.content: Includes all aspects of positive engagement most of the time
Aspects of positive engagement are present only sometimes
Aspects of positive engagement are rarely or never present
Reinforcement is immediate / timely, specific, consistent, varied, natural, contingent, balance between academic and behavior, and age appropriate
Generally consistent reinforcement
Inconsistent reinforcement
Seldom reinforces appropriately
Praise / Redirect ratio of at least 3:1
Praise / Redirect ratio of at least 2:1
Praise / Redirect ratio less than 2:1

rows.tooltip:
1. Consistently follows management plan effectively for problem / academic / social behaviors
2. Consistently responds positively to appropriate academic / social behavior to enhance learning
(delivers consequences as indicated, restates relevant expectations, etc.)

options.content: All problem behaviors addressed using effective management and / or always follows management plan for appropriate academic / social behavior
Most problem behaviors addressed using management plan and / or most of the time follows management plan for appropriate academic / social behavior
Some but not all problem behaviors addressed using management plan and / or sometimes follows management plan for appropriate academic / social behavior
Does not consistently / effectively follow management plan when student engages in problem behavior and / or follow management plan for appropriate academic / social behavior
Data recorded, recorded accurately and aligned to IEP goals / objectives, data collected applicable to decision making
Some data recorded, inconsistent or inaccurate, does not apply to decision making
No data recorded or recorded inaccurately
Data entered daily, all data up to date and available for observer
Data not up to date, inconsistently recorded and / or not available for observer
Appropriate data based decisions made on recorded data
Decisions made subjectively, but not based on recorded data
Inappropriate decisions made

rows.tooltip: Mark N / A if student is an associate teacher

options.content: 90% or higher
69% or lower

tooltip: Refer to USU Department of Special Education and Rehabilitation Professional Guidelines

rows.tooltip:
1. Dresses modestly in clean clothes in good repair
2. Dresses consistent with the dress of teachers and administrators in the school
3. Maintains good personal hygiene

options.content: Dresses appropriately and maintains good personal hygiene
Does not dress appropriately and / or does not maintain personal hygiene

rows.tooltip:
1. Accepts feedback and constructive criticism
2. Acknowledges need for improvement,
3. Asks questions for clarification,
4. Immediately implements recommended changes

options.content: Responds appropriately to constructive criticism
Does not respond appropriately to constructive criticism

rows.tooltip:
1. Implements changes in behavior, procedure, or schedule as recommended
2. Checks with person who provided feedback to receive input on whether implementation is correct

options.content: Correctly implements changes after being given feedback
Does not correctly implement changes after being given feedback

rows.tooltip:
Exhibits appropriate verbal and nonverbal communication
(i.e., tone of voice, facial expression, gestures, etc.)
when interacting with teachers, classroom staff, and students.

options.content: Exhibits positive and respectful attitude in the classroom
Does not exhibit positive and respectful attitude in the classroom

rows.tooltip:
Effective team member, appropriate levels of independence, constructive verbal messages,
listen to and understands feedback, self / social awareness, self / relationship management,
accepts responsibility, self-control, expresses self appropriately, generalized information

options.content: Demonstrates many or all professional attributes
Does not demonstrate or only sometimes demonstrates professional attributes

rows.tooltip:
Interacts appropriately and assigns tasks as needed to classroom staff,
related service personnel, classroom teachers, peer tutors and other school staff

options.content: Interacts appropriately almost all or all of the time
Interacts appropriately some or none of the time

rows.tooltip:
1. Demonstrates adequate progress toward PPAT / assignment completion
2. Follows timelines
3. Submits drafts early enough for feedback
4. Communicates progress with supervisor

options.content: Follows assignment procedure all or most of the time
Does not follow assignment procedure
